storyInfo: His thesis is complete, but not his acknowledgements. Before he gets to writing, Greyy returns to Bolívar, but the Operators at the office there have much to think about on seeing the boy who has clearly grown taller.

attributes.text: Right as I started the very first sentence of this thesis, I immediately began to think about how I would write these acknowledgements.

It has been less than twenty years since I was born. My parents both gave me life, and showed me my first ray of light. Rita, Fernando, and Pedro saved my life. The Doctor and my coworkers in Engineering guided me further down my path toward the future. This is my first step in repaying their kindness: that their names will live in this database forever.\n......

attributes.content: Greyy?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Engineering's got a new field op. Come to the department as soon as you hear this.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Acknowledged. I'm on my way!
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: I'll give you the rundown. We're done mass producing that revamped emergency power system for disasters, as well as its lighting fixtures. Some of the larger offices have enough manpower to install it on their own, so we've already contacted Messengers to get them delivered.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: All that's left now are a few of the smaller offices. In general, they only have a few operators stationed and can't handle this sort of thing.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: We're currently allocating some operators from Engineering to head to those offices and help them install the upgrades. Here's the list.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: You know the drill. If there's anywhere you want to go, just name it. We won't change the schedule to accommodate your plans, though. You're free to get some sightseeing done afterwards, but don't overstay your allotted time.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: May I have a look at the list?
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: I would like to go here, then. The office behind the mountains in Bolívar.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Okay, let me get you registered. Here's all the lighting and testing equipment. You can find the instructions for installing and upgrading the system in the Engineering Department folder on your terminal.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Oh, right. You're from Bolívar, aren't you?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Uh, yes. That's right.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: You don't go back often, so be careful out there. The caravan's leaving at 0700 tomorrow. Be sure to come back on time.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator

attributes.content: Thanks. I'll head back and start packing now.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Okay, I've got my bags packed like the last time we performed on-site service for a customer. I shouldn't need much else.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: They said a buncha new stuff just came in today. C'mon, losers, we're going shopping!
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: I still haven't got my mission signed off yet!
attributes.name: Kazemaru

attributes.content: Istina just passed a new test. I wanna get her a small gift.
attributes.name: Gummy

attributes.content: Everyone says you pick the best gifts, so pleeease!
attributes.name: Gummy

attributes.content: Come to think of it, I've never been to the shopping stalls. Where were they again...?
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Go straight...? Then turn left?
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Oh, they're really here.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Huh, Greyy? Long time no see. The last time I saw you was when you went on a trip with the Engineering folks as an intern. Have you been keeping busy?
attributes.name: Hawking Operator

attributes.content: My internship's almost over. Lately, I've been preparing for my defense.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Oh, hang in there. I pulled out so much hair when I was working on my graduation thesis that my ears were going bald. It took quite a while for it all to grow back.
attributes.name: Hawking Operator

attributes.content: Here, this is the hair growth serum I used. How about it? Want a bottle?
attributes.name: Hawking Operator

attributes.content: W-Well... I think I'll pass.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Haha, in that case, I have some nutritious walnut milk here, too. Works as a great supplement. It's been selling pretty well lately. Don't go telling me you don't need any.
attributes.name: Hawking Operator

attributes.content: I'm not so sure about that either...
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Hehe, just giving you a hard time. It's on the house. A thesis defense is no walk in the park. Drink up and give 'em hell!
attributes.name: Hawking Operator

attributes.content: Thanks, Lily.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Alright, so are you here to buy anything? Hehehe, whatever it is, just leave it to me. I guarantee you'll leave satisfied!
attributes.name: Hawking Operator

attributes.content: Phew... an Originium slug glass ornament, a Metal Crab flower pot, and a home beer brewing kit. Hm, did I really buy the right things...?
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Looks like I'll need to repack now.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.options: Good morning, Greyy.;Hey, Greyy. What's with all that stuff?;Greyy, are you moving?

attributes.content: Good morning, Doctor.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: I'll be leaving for the Bolívar office tomorrow, to help them install the new emergency power system. And I'm thinking of giving these as gifts to the operators stationed there.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.options: How's your defense coming along?;How's your thesis?

attributes.content: I finished writing it already.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Though... I'm still thinking about the acknowledgements in the end.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: I want to give this paper a proper ending.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Once I'm back from this field operation, I will submit my final draft. I hope you don't mind supervising my defense.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.options: Very good. Keep it up.;I'm very strict.
I'm sure that office will love to see you again.;Why don't you put those away and let's chat?

attributes.content: Thank you, Doctor.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: But I need to get going now. I'm leaving tomorrow morning, and I'm still not done packing my luggage and supplies.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Please don't worry, though, I'll be fine.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Thanks, Doctor. See you!
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.text: Electrical engineering is far more complicated and profound than I imagined. Every time I touched upon a small piece of its tapestry, behind was a wealth of wisdom from those who came before me. Through literature, I can borrow their strength and explore the frontiers of technology. I am very happy to have had the opportunity to reach boundaries that would have been untouchable with only my own brain and hands, and I hope that I will be able to spur their advance, if only a little.\n......

attributes.content: A few weeks later...
So... do you guys actually like these?
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: We'll put the glass ornament here. The flower pot looks lovely, too. And what's this, equipment for homebrewing?!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Where did you get this, Greyy? How did you even know *where* to get this? You're not even that old yet! How could you be an alcoholic already?!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: No, I—
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: *Sigh*... You even know to bring back gifts. You've really grown up, Greyy...
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: It's always the same old here, though, hahaha! Everyone else comes and goes, but the three of us are forever!
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: But, Greyy, are you really sure you want to start working right away? You just got here. I think you should get some rest first.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: The landship doesn't expect you guys to work to the bone, does it?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: All I know is that when we sent you there, they'd just got a new leader called the 'Doctor,' who apparently accomplished quite a bit these past few years.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: But I thought you went to get treatment? Why'd they give you such back-breaking field work? Is this Doctor fella really so heartless to exploit you guys like that?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: You're a patient. You spent so many days just getting here, and now you have to start working the moment you arrive, without even stopping for a sip of water?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Greyy already told us in his message that this is something he wants to do himself, Fernando.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Please, the Doctor isn't that kind of person. The landship is a great place, too. I'm only here because I chose to come.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: I've been interning at the Engineering Department, and I'm even getting ready for my thesis defense now. Besides, don't you think I've gotten taller, and my body sturdier?
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: I'll just be inspecting the electrical circuits to compare with the model we drew up. That way, it'll go much smoother when I start working tomorrow. It's not too much effort.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Really?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Why are you so paranoid? Why would he lie to you?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Fernando, the Doctor even told me before I left that you guys would be happy to see me again.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: So they even know about our connection, huh?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Alright... Not the worst leader, at least.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Greyy, why don't you come down from the ladder and try some of the local Bolívarian dishes I made. You're still growing, so you gotta eat up.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Oh, look at you. You're almost as tall as me. And you were so small when we first brought you back...
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Ah, um...
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Embarrassed?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Hahaha. Let's not talk about that right now. Actually, we were discussing amongst ourselves earlier, and there's something we wanted to talk to you about.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: You mentioned in your letter that you're studying at the Engineering Department and that you're an electrical engineer now. That's good. You've got ambition.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: It's just... As a doctor, I...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Rita, let me tell him.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Greyy, all the things you said. That you're making equipment, writing a thesis, preparing your defense, and that you're going to keep studying. Even that 'touching upon the boundaries of modern technology' stuff.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: All that is your decision to make, and it's not our place to say anything. However, we really didn't want to bring this up, but you're still sick...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Don't worry, Rita. The medicine they have on the landship is very effective.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Besides, there are a lot of patients like me there. Some of them are even worse off, yet still much stronger than I am.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: I'm not saying this to make light of my condition. It's just when I see them all working so hard every day, it makes me feel much better too.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Alright, as long as you know the score. It's important to think these things through before doing anything. We just wanted to let you know that.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: You two done?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Greyy, stand up and let me take a look at you.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Not bad. Your physique's pretty good for a Perro boy your age.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: But you do know you're Infected, right?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: *Cough*... Watch your mouth, Fernando.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Why you gotta be so sarcastic in front of the kid?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Of course I know that.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: But this is what I chose to do.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: I know how you feel. Kids are bound to have ideals when they're young.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: But I'm more worried about you.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: I'm going to send in an application tomorrow and request to have you stationed here from now on.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: I read your medical record all those years ago. 0.3u/L. That means your condition will deteriorate the moment you stop paying close attention to your health. We don't have the clearance to get your new records these days. What's your density at now?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: You're writing code, making equipment, training in metalwork. I can believe that HQ is committed to its goals, but I'm worried that you might not know what you should really be doing.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Fernando!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: He's all grown up now. That's uncalled for!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Besides, it doesn't matter how worried we are. You can't just force your wishes on him—
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: *Cough*—Let's eat first. Eat up!
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Try the soup before it gets cold. Here, give it a taste.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Thanks, uncle Pedro.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Let me do the dishes later.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: No!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: You're not doing anything! Leave them there, I'll do the dishes!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Okay...
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Greyy wipes a drop of sweat from his nose and inputs the updated data into his terminal.
The light emitted by the electrical device fluctuates unsteadily before slowly stabilizing.
The rooms in the office fall into a brief darkness before lighting up even brighter than before, thanks to the new system.
Greyy runs some tests on his terminal. Even his breath is slowing down.
Greyy, are you that short on time? Here, let me help you. Anything you need me to do?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Yeah, it's a huge upgrade, so there's quite a lot to handle, but I can deal with it myself.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Back when I was your age, my parents never let me touch nothing whenever I got sick. They'd just lock me inside the house, hoping I'd get better sooner.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Back then, I didn't get it. I thought they were limiting my freedom. When my friends got sick, they still got to head out with their parents for work, but I had to stay home alone.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Now, well over a decade later, I finally understand how they felt. My family's not poor. They had the means to let me rest up, instead of having to work through my illness.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: If you, a patient, have to come all the way out here just to change our goddamn light bulbs, I seriously doubt that staying on the landship will really help you figure out what you want to do.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: You're too inflexible, Fernando.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Why don't you take a few days off and try to remember why you joined Rhodes Island in the first place? Because it sounds like you've forgotten.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Not only did you insult Greyy, you insulted HQ itself.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Are you angry?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Me too.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: I'm angry that I'm so powerless. I'm acting like a rude, unreasonable parent because there's nothing I could do to give you a better future.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: This is Greyy's decision, Fernando. HQ is just respecting his decision and providing him with more opportunities.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: We can't live his life for him. The landship's a bigger platform.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: What he's doing is choosing to die! Out of all my friends from back then, I'm the only one who's an operator here and still healthy. Everyone else is working at factories in god-knows-where, catching Oripathy and dying before they know it.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Do you know how it felt watching their ashes scattered from the nomadic cities?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: And him! He should've had more choices available to him!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Even though he's Infected, he could've chosen another path, and lived out his life healthy and safe!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: I'm not Infected, and neither are you or Rita. As long as a war doesn't break out, we can look forward to a long life. I don't want to watch him die before me, just like all my old friends!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: I'm prepared, but I'm not *that* prepared. I'm just a normal guy who was born and raised in Bolívar, and I'm only working here to try to save a couple more Infected for the sake of those friends of mine.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: I'm not rescuing people just to watch them work themselves to death!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Fernando!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: We both knew about his past, but he's always so easily offended. We could've just talked it out, but he just had to pick a fight...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Hm... Last time, you and I had a row with him for over two hours, but I still saw you two go fishing that weekend.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: It's not the same.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: This is about Greyy and our ideals. It's no small quarrel—
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: What just happened?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Greyy?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: *Sniffles*...
Greyy? Are you crying?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Don't be sad. We aren't fighting. We're just...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Greyy, are you still up there on the ladder? Come back down!
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: (Blows nose)...
Fernando? That was you? Where's Greyy?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I'm here, Rita! There were some problems with the power supply system. It's okay, I can fix it no problem.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Fernando...
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: *Sobs*... If I'd known this was going to happen, I wouldn't have told you that you helped us, and that we'd wait for you to come back to help us again...
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Look at those clothes... It must've been exhausting to travel all this way from the landship, but you didn't even mention it... How could you be like this?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: I spend every day thinking that it's all because I went along with them, and told you we needed you to light up the place. That I made you choose to walk such a difficult path...
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: It's my fault. It's all my fault! You're in such a hurry to get working... You aren't going to leave right away too, are you?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: When's the next time we'll see you? In another few years?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Fernando, that's not it...
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Really, this isn't that onerous. The reason I'm not complaining isn't because I'm trying to hide anything from you, it's because it's really not difficult.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Please don't cry. Here, one sec.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Take a look. This is the emergency power system I developed with the other operators at the Engineering Department.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: I can make the lights here stabler and brighter than before. There won't be a moment of darkness here, even if it's pouring outside.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Before, you needed a generator just to barely light up a single tent in the mountains, but soon I'll be able to illuminate every home here, even the entire mountain, forever.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: This is my technology, and it's what I'm working on now.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: You're right. It might be taxing on my body and my health, and I may not have that much time left.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: But please also try to see what I'm getting out of it.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: It's not just a couple lanterns in the slums, or a few houses. I have the ability to bring light to even more places. What I'm doing now will pay off over the next dozen years, perhaps even decades to come.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: And if I can do this much, why not do even more?
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: If, back then... my house had been this bright, I wouldn't have turned out like this.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: And since I can do this now, I hope to keep anyone who finds themselves where I was from retracing the path that I took.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: So no one will follow the path your friends took, either.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: (So they still ended up fighting...)
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: (Trying to stop them isn't going to help. Fernando isn't going to change his mind, either.)
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: (I need to prove myself and tell him that I'll be fine. That's the only way to stop them.)
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: (This code... Sorry, I'll fix this for you later. Let me put a wrong value here first...)
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Greyy, I know what you're saying, and I'm not as hotheaded as Fernando.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: But as a doctor, and the person who lied to you and made you think you helped us all those years ago, I have to ask you this question.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I'm sure you realized long ago that that was a lie, and I'm not going to try to sugarcoat it as some kind of white lie.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: That was something I, as an adult, blurted out without thinking it through. I even dragged them into my lie, and this definitely influenced your decision in some capacity.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: What I want to ask you now is, let's say we could do this all over. Except this time, you'd know that we were lying. Would you still be using your Originium Arts to bring us a light that it turns out we never actually needed?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I would.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: Even if you'd have no idea whether it would be of any use to us?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I would, and I'll keep doing it going forward. I hate the darkness, and I don't want it to be a source of fear for anyone else.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: It doesn't matter whether I'm sure that it will actually be useful.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Greyy, these are your own ideals and your own life. Of course we'll support you.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.text: I still have doubts about a few things.

Why did Rita ask me that question in the end? Aside from repaying favors, all my actions have been shaped by my mother, and I always do what she would do. I extend a helping hand to others, and strive to bring light to even more people, yet I never think about myself. I have very little time because of my Oripathy, but I have also seen and experienced a great many things. I will not stop in my tracks.
And I will persevere even while uncertain how useful that will actually be.
My goal for the future will always be to shine light on even more people. I will cast this light from my hands and illuminate even vaster swaths of land.

attributes.content: Good morning, Doctor.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: My thesis and equipment are ready.
attributes.name: Greyy

attributes.content: I am ready for my defense.
attributes.name: Greyy
